New Records: Chris Sale has recorded eight or more strikeouts in three of his last four appearances against AL opponents.
Jarred Kelenic has recorded at least one RBI in four of the Braves' last five games as favorites against AL East opponents.
Chris Sale has recorded a win in eight of his last 10 appearances with the Braves as favorites against AL opponents.
Pre-Game Insights: The Braves will send out Chris Sale as their starter, who has a strong record with a 2.46 ERA this season.
The Blue Jays will have Yariel Rodriguez on the mound, who has struggled with a 4.61 ERA in his 17 starts this season.
The Braves have struggled defensively recently, giving up 17 hits in their last game.
The Blue Jays have been underperforming in day games, with their last three day games going UNDER the total runs line.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the final game of a three-game series between the Blue Jays and Braves.
The Braves rank 29th in the league for steals and 2nd for ERA this season.
The Blue Jays rank 5th for doubles and 6th for strikeouts against this season.
Others: The game is being played at Truist Park, the Braves' home field.
The series is significant as it features two strong teams competing for playoff positioning.
